title: How to Draw a Realistic Eye

steps.title: Draw the shape of the eye.
steps.content: Draw the shape of the eye.

steps.title: Draw the details for the pupils, iris and eyebrows.
steps.content: Draw the details for the pupils, iris and eyebrows.

steps.title: Draw the details for the eyelashes, pupil highlights, iris and eyebrows.
steps.content: Draw the details for the eyelashes, pupil highlights, iris and eyebrows.

steps.title: Apply light shading over the drawing to simulate light shadows.
steps.content: Apply light shading over the drawing to simulate light shadows.

steps.title: Complete the drawing by using a darker shade to fill areas with darker shadows.
steps.content: Complete the drawing by using a darker shade to fill areas with darker shadows.

steps.title: Draw the shape of the eye.
steps.content: Draw the shape of the eye. Use magazines of photographs as guides for drawing different types of eyes. This is step one.

steps.title: Draw the Pupil and the Iris.
steps.content: Draw the Pupil and the Iris.

steps.title: Use a darker shade to draw over the artwork.
steps.content: Use a darker shade to draw over the artwork.

steps.title: Apply a light gray tone or shade over the eye
steps.content: Apply a light gray tone or shade over the eye

steps.title: Apply a slightly darker shade for light shadowed areas.
steps.content: Apply a slightly darker shade for light shadowed areas.

steps.title: Apply a darker shade of gray for darker areas or you could try to shade in to the little details.
steps.content: Apply a darker shade of gray for darker areas or you could try to shade in to the little details.

steps.title: Apply the darkest gray for areas with very dark shadows (but not black).
steps.content: Apply the darkest gray for areas with very dark shadows (but not black).

steps.title: Blend the edges of each layer of gray to simulate a realistic eye using shades of gray.
steps.content: Blend the edges of each layer of gray to simulate a realistic eye using shades of gray.
